chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn C Knox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn C Knox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn C Knox was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Shawn C Knox was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge and court costs  remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.   Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Obtain & Maintain mental health treatment. Take all medications as prescribed.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Any outstanding court costs as previously ordered.
Any outstanding restitution as previously ordered.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
